name: Hotel Balestri

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Family run Hotel one block from the Ponte Vecchio. Room was large and had two windows overlooking the Arno. Everything was clean and tidy and the breakfast was good. Not very expensive either. Good value and very central - about 5 minutes to Santa Croche.
reviews.title: Excellent
Very pleased with the Balestri
reviews.text: The Balestri has a great location in Florence, just a block from the Uffizi and right on the Arno river. We had a great view of the Ponte Vecchio from our room. The staff were very helpful, the room was comfortable, and we had one of the more spacious bathrooms we found in our trip to Greece and Italy. Breakfast was wonderful, served in a charming dining room. We couldn't have been happier with this hotel, it was very convenient for sight seeing and dining. We walked from the hotel to the train station and back when we were taking a side trip, but with luggage you'll be much better off with a taxi.

This hotel has a great location, next to Arno River and down the street from Ponte Vecchio. Minutes away from main attractions. The room was clean and the breakfast was great. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay here next time in Florence.
reviews.title: super hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our stay at the Hotel Balestri on recommendation from a friend, and glad we did. The hotel is located on the river, with great views, a short 5 minute stroll from the Uffizi and the Piazza della Signoria, just enough away to be out of the hustle and bustle. Reception staff were friendly and very helpful, room was clean and light, (3rd floor with view across the river), bathroom large and clean, (shower and bath). Breakfast was the usual pastries, cold meat, cheese coffee etc. Only one slight gripe, even though the room had air conditioning, it was quite noisy so we switched off at night to go to sleep, otherwise a perfect stay. We would have no hesitation to stay here again.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel, Good location

reviews.text: This is not a luxury hotel, but it is a very comfortable, gracious, and updated hotel with a charming lobby, excellent breakfast, and terrific location. The Uffizi and Santa Croce are less than a five minute walk away. The staff was helpful with dining suggestions. We were unable to stay in waterview rooms but we did book through a tour operator and probably were given standard rooms. The rooms, despite the non water view, were fine, good sized, and comfortable. I would definitely consider this a very pleasant reasonably priced spot for exploring Florence.
reviews.title: Easy Location and Lovely Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed there in march. The hotel was nice, the room nice, if a little spartan, and the location absolutely fantastic. Breakfast was good and staff nice and friendly. Some of the other reviews are beyond my ability to understand. Elevator small but fine. My wife and i would both stay here again. the Hotel was not as plush as the vis a vis in sestri levante or the pensione accedemia in venice, but at 120 euro the price was right.
reviews.title: A nice place to stay in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed at the Hotel Balestri for 2 nights in February. While I do not recommend this hotel, I can't find fault with its location - across the street from the Arno River, a short walk to the Ponte Vecchio, Santa Maria Croce and the Uffizi. While the hotel was under renovation during our stay - that wasn't even the issue. The front desk staff were so rude! The woman who checked us in (early afternoon) seemed so put off when I asked if she had a map of Florence (this was in stark contrast to our stay in Rome and Venice). There always seemed to be two people at the desk in the evening - an older gentleman and a kid (I'm sure he was older than a "kid" but to me he looked 15). The older man couldn't be bothered to acknowledge us and the younger man seemed uncomfortable to be there. The breakfast was by far the worst of the three hotels (Hotel Nazionale in Rome and Hotel Doge Orseolo in Venice) and barely edible. Stale bread - ugh! I would not stay here again - I know there must be better!
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Balestri was going under restoration by the time my husband and I arrived. Therefore, this review won't take under consideration the problems caused by the works (which were temporary), nor the benefits of its future completion.
reviews.title: Could be better
Good hotel
reviews.text: Restoration aside, our room on the first floor was clearly worn out, with old furniture and appliances. Bathroom and general cleanness inside the room were OK. But one day there was a long lasting problem to get hot water in the shower (which is particularly painful in winter time...). There was no elevator (we were told that in advance).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, the positive features: the location is great (right by the Arno river, with a great view, and also close to Piazza de la Signoria and other main attractions); the front desk people were helpful; breakfast was OK; beautiful lobby.
reviews.title: you can do better

reviews.text: I found Hotel Balestri on the web and decided to book in because it was relatively inexpensive and well rated. It lived up to my expectations. It was pleasant, well-lit, and clean. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Everthing from ordering a cab, to using their computer, to cashing traveller's checks, to checking in and out was effortless. The location, across the street from the Arno and 5 to 10 minutes from the major sites, is wonderful. The room was small but if you are not planning to hold a party there, it is perfectly comforatble!! My room faced over the city with a nice view of Brunelleschi's dome, and it was very quiet. I didn't eat there so I have no opinion of the food. I would recommend Hotel Balestri to anyone going to Florence. Grazie per tutti Hotel Balestri.
reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff: i'd stay there again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our arrival we were greeted by really friendly english speaking hotel staff - they were helpful throughout our stay providing directions and great recommendations for places to eat.
reviews.title: Recommend this hotel - good value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was large with a large simple bathroom including bath and shower. Room was more than adequate and comfortable with a large window. Although we didn't have a river view, our view was still more than pleasant as it opened onto a little piazza.
reviews.title: Excellent room and Location

likes.liked: — Great hotel and location at a reasonable price.
likes.disliked: — Pay Internet - don't they have DSL in Italy? Sheesh!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great in charming surroundings. There was a wide variety of food with good coffee served by the staff. Easy to fill up for the day!
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.text: Overall, we would recommend this hotel - staff were great, room was comfortable, clean and large and breakfast was good!
reviews.title: great location, very comfortable

reviews.text: Our stay at the Hotel Balestri was our best expereince in all of Italy! The hotel is exquisitely designed with very clean rooms that are the most spacious I have every stayed in in all of Europe. The staff was VERY friendly and very helpful and went out of their way to assist us, especially during a taxi strike. The location was on the banks of the Arno and away from the crowded alleys of Florence. We had a great view from our room! Very close to the Ponte Vecchio and the Ufizzi.
reviews.title: The Best place to stay!

likes.liked: — The cleanliness and size of the rooms!
likes.disliked: — The limited selections for continental breakfast.

reviews.title: Not Highly Recommended
reviews.text: Hotel Balestri, though a nice property with a great location, was not our favorite in Italy. We found the staff to be less than courteous. The lobby is beautiful, but the rooms were a bit worn and dirty. Many rooms have a lovely view of the Arno and Ponte Veccio, but you can only open the terrace during the daylight hours due to bugs in the evening. Their breakfast was fine.
The three of use stayed here June 16-June 19th.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel !

reviews.text: The location is excellent, close to the Ufizzi Gallery,Science Museum, Santa Croce church.
reviews.title: very clean

description: The Balestri Hotel is located in the heart of Florence, on the right bank of the Arno river, few steps from the Ponte Vecchio (Old Bridge), Palazzo Vecchio and the Uffizi Gallery. Close to the Hotel is Via Tornabuoni, the world known shopping street with the greatest international high fashion brands.
